comment.author: 47524421@N08
comment._content:
This famous Boeing 247D NC13369 c/n 1953 was flown by Roscoe Turner and Clyde Pangborn in the 1934 MacRobertson race from England to Australia as '57' and came in second. It had been modified with extra fuel tanks. 
Currently displayed in the Hall of Air Transportation at the National Air and Space Museum, Washington, DC with United Air Lines colors and registration as NC13369 on its right fuselage and wing and as NR257Y with MacRobertson Race markings on its left side.
